VAT £ inc.VAT Options Colour: Black Back Panel White Back Panel Clear Back Panel Clear Frost Back Panel Coloured Back Panel 2: 2: Qty Add to basket Get a quote Staff Photo Notice Boards - Perspex Acrylic Staff photo notice boards, or "Meet The Team" boards are a perfect way of letting people know who's who in a school, NHS Wards, general office and commercial workplace, recreation centres, reception areas, etc. Each clear pocket allows a small photo of a relevent member of staff. Options available include: choice of back acrylic colour, the number of photo pockets. We also offer a secure, tamper proof version, please click here for further details. NEW! We can now offer staff boards with your name and logo printed directlty to the top of the display - call for details. Features and Benefits: Please double click on the above images of our acrylic staff photo boards to zoom into a more detailed view Staff photo boards provide a professioal looking wall mounted display panel for quick reference of staff / team members Choice of black, white, clear or clear frost 5mm thick acrylic back panel with polished edges. Corners are rounded with no sharp edges Clear acrylic photo pockets allow staff photos to be changed quickly and easily Supplied with 4 polished sign fittings to give that floating effect off a wall Each photo pocket size is 75mm high x 50mm wide Header panel pocket is 260mm wide x 50mm high Please see the table below for our standard sized staff photo boards. We also manufacture custom sized boards if you require different sized pockets or different quantities of pockets - please call us on 01202 480104 for further details. Staff photo board prices are detailed in the drop down menu at the top of the page. Manufactured to order in our factory in Christchurch, Dorset, UK. Please allow 5 working days for delivery Please see our stand off fittings instructions by clicking here Looking for a a more secure staff photo board which can't be tampered with? Check out our Secure Staff Photo Boards ! Looking for a staff photo board with a different coloured back panel? We have a range of colours available other than our standard colours listed! Please contact us for a quote. Looking for a staff photo board with bespoke printing and branding to suit your business? With state of the art printers, we are able to fully print or brand these staff boards with your logos and messages! If this is something you are interested in, contact us for a quote! Code Photo Pockets Frame Size Width x Height (mm) SB10 10 430mm x 325mm SB20 20 430mm x 515mm SB30 30 500mm x 610mm SB40 40 640mm x 610mm SB50 50 780mm x 610mm SB60 60 780mm x 705mm SB65 65 800mm x 740mm SB70 70 780mm x 800mm SB80 80 780mm x 895mm SB100 100 780mm x 1085mm SB120 120 920mm x 1085mm SB140 140 1060mm x 1085mm SB160 160 1200mm x 1090mm Displays UK provide daily deliveries to most towns and cities in the UK including: Christchurch, Poole, Bournemouth, Swanage, Dorchester, Ferndown, Shaftesbury Sherborne Sturminster Newton Swanage Weymouth Ringwood New Forest Fordingbridge Salisbury Thank you for visiting our website Product Code: 64674569876345 Specification Code 64674569876345 Style Staff Photo Board Location Wall Mounted Weight 10.000 Kg Secured by sagePay Pay with PayPal Pay with Mastercard Pay with Visa × Items Quick basket Newsletter Signup Submit Exhibition Stands Outdoor Displays Display Cases Exhibition & Display Boards for Hire or Rent Leaflet, Brochure, Menu & Card Holders Banner Stands Counters & Plinths Noticeboards & Whiteboards Signage & Perspex Frames Display Boards Specialist Displays Perspex Cut To Size Displays (UK) Limited Displays UK are located in Christchurch, on the Hampshire / Dorset border. Family-owned and operated on Main Street for over 30 years. Offering daily specials, happy-hour pricing, and a mini-food menu. The souvenir stand in the main bar area offers classic Froggy's designed t-shirts, event patch and other branded merchandise. Contest Rules Events Latest Latest from Froggy Entertainment & News Storm Closings Connect Contact Us Join the Country Club Facebook Instagram X I'm Listening 1Thing Advertise With Us Contact Us Phone number: 1-800-570-1013 Text number: 800-570-1013 Studio Phone: 1-800-570-1013 Contest/Prize Fulfillment Questions: Tori 570-602-2580 Business Office: 570-883-9800 Traffic Jam Line: 570-883-7269 Address: Audacy Pennsylvania, LLC | WGGY-FM 305 HWY 315 Pittston Pa, 18640 Office Hours: Monday through Friday (except Holidays) 9am - 2:30pm ----------------------------------- Frequently Asked Questions How can I win a prize? For call-to-win contests, online contests, and text contests, all of the details can be found on the Contests page on this website. If a contest has ended within the last 30 days, you can find that information on the Contest Rules page on this website. How do I get my prize? You must be a verified winner and complete all necessary paperwork online before you will get your prize. Emails will be coming from our prize platform SPARC - check your spam folder.  If you don't get the email immediately after winning a prize from us, contact us right away. Once you have completed all of the paperwork, how you get your prize depends on what you have won. In every case listed below, this will be communicated to you as we walk you through the paperwork process. Tickets: Digital Tickets to concerts will be received within 48 hours of the event. In some cases, it may be within 24 hours of the event. Some shows may require will call fulfillment. If this is the case, the original winner’s name will be sent to the box office at the venue for ticket pick-up after 5p the day-of the show. Tickets for these shows cannot be transferred and must be picked up by the original winner with a valid for form of identification. Some gift cards, gift certificates, vouchers, etc: Whenever possible, we will mail the prize to you via USPS first class mail to the address you provided to us when you completed the paperwork. Physical prizing: If a prize is too bulky, too valuable, or not replaceable, you will be instructed to pick up the prize at our offices during normal business hours (listed above). In some cases you may be able to send someone on your behalf, but only if you have completed all required paperwork online and only if you let us know that person's name beforehand. Photo ID will be required. I received a message or comment on Facebook saying I won a prize. Did I actually win? This station DOES NOT execute any social media contests. We may promote a contest on social, but we will never ask you to comment, like, or share a post in order to enter or win a contest. We will also NEVER ask you for any personal information like your phone number, date of birth, social security number, or banking information through social media. Be careful of scammers. For further questions, contact Tori Thomas - tori.thomas@audacy.com or call 570-602-2580. What are mobile tickets and how do I claim them? Mobile tickets are a gift from COVID-19 that allows us to easily transfer you tickets via the free Ticketmaster/Live Nation/AXS and other mobile ticketing apps. Once we transfer the tickets, you will receive an email from Ticketmaster/Live Nation/AXS, etc. asking you to claim your tickets. Make sure you have the proper app downloaded and have an account created before clicking “Claim Tickets” in the email. Once you claim the tickets, you will receive another email from Ticketmaster/Live Nation/AXS to “View and Save Your Tickets”. You can use this link to view your tickets or, if you have the app downloaded, the tickets should appear in the “My Tickets” or “My Events” part of the app. Claiming Mobile Tickets: You will receive an email from Ticketmaster/Live Nation/AXS, etc. with the subject, “The station just sent you ticket(s) for a concert…” Please open the email and accept the ticket transfer by: 1.      On your smartphone, open your email, and tap the Accept Tickets button in the email. 2.     Sign in to the Ticketmaster/Live Nation/AXS account to accept your tickets. o   If you don’t have an account, create a new account with the email you are currently using on this thread. It’s the day-of the show and I have not received my tickets. What should I do? First of all, do not wait until the day of the show to ask about the status of your tickets. Secondly, do not panic. Email Tori Thomas - tori.thomas@audacy.com or call 570-602-2580. --------------------------------------- Still have Questions? on Loving lunch specials in spokane valley Meandering Valley Thoughts Northwest Travel Opening Business in Spokane Valley Reviews and comments Scott Creach Spokane Valley Bars Spokane Valley Coffee Houses Spokane Valley Dining Spokane Valley Folks Spokane valley lunch specials Spokane Valley Seafood Uncategorized Ryan Heaton of Senor Froggy’s has been shining at dining for 37 years Posted: February 19, 2013 in Best Places to eat in Spokane Valley Tags: ryan heaton , senor froggies spokane valley 2 I have known Ryan Heaton, owner of the Valley Senior Froggys since about 1973 when he and I played trumpet  at Bowdish Junior High. I was a consistent third or fourth chair below Renny Smith and Teresa Tsalaky while Ryan, who was a year younger, normally sat far below. Everyone hated those surprise tryouts that publicly and painfully exposed our lack of musical talent and lazy practicing habits. Anything could happen. More than once I sat at the bottom after a humiliating attempt, only to look up the line to see Ryan beaming back down at me from my old chair after he had pulled off an unusually good performance. Even on his best trumpet days, I would not have put him on my most-likely-to-succeed list. It was not  until high school when he began bussing tables at the Valley Red Lion that it became apparent that he possessed first-chair talent in the hospitality field . One year out of high school at age 19, he was managing The 1881 Room at the Sheraton Hotel downtown.  Back then Patsy Clark’s was their main competition, today it would be Churchill’s or Spencer’s, which is at the 1881 Room’s former location. After problems developed with a new general manager, Ryan thought he could do better and so applied for the manager position when it came open at the neighboring Casablanca restaurant, owned by the Omni Corporation. They liked the looks of the kid but not the idea of him running a place where he was not old enough to go into the bar, especially when its nightclub was downtown’s hottest. They lured him away by offering him a better salary and a manager position at their Taco Time on Division. At one time, Omni had a big operation in Spokane. They owned Casablanca, all the Taco Times, Fuddrucker’s and The Rocking Horse Saloon. Ryan became a key team player they moved  around to run other local Taco Times for a few years. Then they sent him to  California to open a new Fuddrucker’s before coming back to open and manage their new Spokane Fudruckers, a gourmet hamburger franchise . By the time he was 25, they put him at the helm of their starship, The Casablanca where he was in charge of four assistant managers and 95 employees. After meeting Dave Hooke at a golf tournament, Ryan decided it would be better to raise is two young boys on fast food. The plan was that he would be allowed to buy into Dave’s  local franchise, Senor Froggys, a move designed to help fund Dave’s retirement and secure one for himself. That was 23 years ago and things have progressed nicely, with Ryan owning the Valley and Indiana Froggy’s. The nice progress has come through a battle of wits and hard work against difficulties like  relentless national competition, an abysmal economy and a traffic shift that did not work in his favor. Ryan has kept his Froggys hopping by using two key strategies. One of the strategies was cutting edge when he became a Bruchi’s franchisee and co-branded it together with his two Senior Froggy’s  11 years ago. He was the first in Spokane to implement this nationwide trend, offering two original Spokane franchises in one location. Beyond menus that complimented each other, Ryan and Bruce Greene, founder and owner of Bruchi’s worked well together, having known each other from the Casablanca days when Bruce was an assistant manager under Ryan. Currently, they are partners in the new Cheney Bruchi’s and up until January, Ryan ran the North Town and Valley Mall Bruchi’s. Knowing a year in advance that he would be loosing his lease at the malls, Ryan  took the co-branding concept to the next level, coco-branding, and brought in Itallalian Express, another local franchise that had been started by Dave Hooke with recipes provided by  Luigi’s owner, Marty Hoberg , who had been one of Ryan’s busboy at the 1881 Room. The second strategy Ryan has implemented is himself. He will tell you he believes he has been  at the same location for 23 years because they deliver a consistent, quality product for a good price. While that may be true, Ryan is the one who has ensured those standards day in, day out. He is hands-on and works everyday, 40 hours a week. When you combine that work ethic with a 1st-chair talent for playing to a room full of diners, The Froggie is going to make it even in the rough waters of the Spokane Valley fast food pond. When I took Mom to lunch there the other day, he took our order at the counter and delivered the meal. It occurred to me how unusual it is at a fast food place for anyone, let alone the owner, to bring the food out even though it seems like a pretty simple but accommodating service to provide. I guess that it is something that only an owner who enjoyed working with his crew and serving his customers would be happy to do. I would imagine most owners would not enjoy either. I could tell Ryan, however, is the oddball and is happy to be doing what he was doing and to be where he is at. As I sat looking up at him from my chair as he cheerfully cleared our table, I recognized that  look of contentment on his face from forty years before and I knew it was genuine. I have no problem vouching for their raviolli. They also offer it with alfredo. Mom will have to vouch for their chimichanga. It must be good because she has been eating this at Senor Froggies for years. All I know is that it looks mighty tempting. The only thing happier than that frog on the outside is the big bullfrog on the inside. Related Comments rcfryguy@aol.com says: February 20, 2013 at 6:36 pm Thanks for the compliments Craig,  Renny Smith and Teresa Tsalaky boy did that bring back memories of Mr. Shook and the Bowdish days. I still fondly think of the Percussion Naut days probably the best summer of my teenage life!   Mel Clayton actually ate at the restaurant a few months back and I run into Renny quite frequently ( he is in a business partnership with a close friend). Glad you enjoyed your meal the other day, hopefully you will be back to enjoy more of my fare in the months to come. See you soon! Reply rcfryguy@aol.com says: February 21, 2013 at 5:15 pm Craig,  Some spelling info.  Senor Froggy’s.  Fuddruckers. Dave Hooke and Bruce Greene. I don’t think that we can say that the Italian Express was a concept started by Dave Hooke AND Marty Hoberg as the concept was only started by Dave Hooke with some input on Recipes and menu development from Marty Hoberg that gave him the right initially to call it Luigi’s Italian express, However the Luigis was taken off the sign and was just renamed Italian express after Marty and Dave had a dis-agreement on some issues.. FYI Other than that everything else is pretty much in line with my small life story with the exception of a small stent in Seattle…but you know that… Ryan Reply Leave a comment Cancel reply Δ Go to a Lovers’ Pearl Apart for Valentine’s Day An Amazing Young Woman Blog at WordPress.com.
